Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
The defendant ANTHONY M BEAUDOIN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

9:30 AM Defendant ANTHONY M BEAUDOIN in court.  Attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer in court for ANTHONY M BEAUDOIN.  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of and waives rights.  Enters plea freely and voluntarily and proceeds to sentencing.  Victim/Witness rights complied with.  Agreement for term of probation to amended Count 1.  Amended information needs to be filed.  Parties waive right to Pre-Sentence Investigation Report.  Request 2 days sentence credit.

9:49 AM  Defendant ANTHONY M BEAUDOIN does not appear in court.  Attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer in court for ANTHONY M BEAUDOIN.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Jeanne Struve in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Patzer advises her client is on his way to court and requests to hear matter at a later time this morning.  

10:36 AM  RECALLED  Defendant ANTHONY M BEAUDOIN appears in court.  Attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer in court for ANTHONY M BEAUDOIN.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Jeanne Struve in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Patzer advises there is a resolution and moves to adjourn matter out 2 weeks due to a family emergency on defendant's behalf.  No objection by State.  Court removes jury trial and grants adjournment.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
